intro: Smithiantha laui, commonly known as the purple-flowered rock heath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, often arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, Smithiantha laui is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
